info.title: Tickets
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: When a customer contacts your support team to request help with an issue, create a ticket to track that request and keep a record of it for future reference.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the tickets API to create and manage CRM records that represent customer service requests in your CRM.

post.description: Retrieve a batch of tickets by ID (`ticketId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`).

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

get.description: Retrieve a ticket by its ID (`ticketId`) or by a unique property (`idProperty`). You can specify what is returned using the `properties` query parameter.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

delete.description: Archive a ticket, sending it to the recycling bin. Deleted tickets can be restored within 90 days of deletion. Learn more about [restoring records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).

parameters.name: ticketId
parameters.description: The ID of the ticket to delete.

patch.description: Update a ticket by ID (`ticketId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`). Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

post.summary: Merge two tickets with same type
post.description: Merge two tickets, combining them into one ticket record.

post.summary: Archive a batch of tickets by ID
post.description: Delete a batch of tickets by ID. Deleted tickets can be restored within 90 days of deletion. Learn more about [restoring records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).

Create a batch of tickets. The `inputs` array can contain a `properties` object to define property values for the ticket, along with an `associations` array to define [associations](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.

Update a batch of tickets by ID (`ticketId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`). Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

get.description: Retrieve a ticket by its ID (`ticketId`) or by a unique property (`idProperty`). You can specify what is returned using the `properties` query parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be read by a single request.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create a single ticket. Include a `properties` object to define [property values](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/properties) for the ticket, along with an `associations` array to define [associations](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.

post.summary: Create or update a batch of tickets by unique property values
post.description: Create and update a batch of tickets by a unique property. Tickets that don't exist will be created, while existing tickets will be updated.

Search for tickets by filtering on properties, searching through associations, and sorting results. Learn more about [CRM search](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/search#make-a-search-request).

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)
